Senior Accountant Job at Un Arena by LVG Lifestyle




        
    

        
        At Un Arena by LVG Lifestyle, indulge in the epitome of extravagance at Un Arena Resort & Spa by LVG Lifestyle, an exclusive enclave where opulence meets leisure. Situated amidst the tranquil surroundings of Lekki, Lagos, our prestigious establishment caters to individuals seeking the finest in experiences. Whether you yearn for the finest cigars or a rejuvenating spa retreat, our resort promises to exceed your every desire and expectation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Availability: Immediate Joining

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Senior Accountant is responsible for overseeing daily accounting operations, ensuring accuracy in financial reporting, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards, company policies, and statutory regulations.
	The role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to supervise junior accountants while supporting management with strategic financial insights.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage the general accounting functions, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, and general ledger.
	Prepare accurate and timely financial statements, reports, and reconciliations.
	Ensure compliance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and relevant tax regulations.
	Review journal entries, account reconciliations, and supporting documentation prepared by junior staff.
	Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning processes.
	Monitor and analyze accounting data to provide insights and recommendations to management.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field
	Minimum of 3 -5 years of accounting experience


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ahr@lvglifestyle.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Accommodation is available.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Manager",
  "description": "Barama Energy Resources is committed to be among the world&rsquo;s best global energy companies, most admired for its people, services, partnership and performance while adhering to the highest standards of business conduct.

We are dully approved and certified by the Nigerian Content Development &amp; Monitoring Board (NCDMB) and Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR) in respect of in-country specifics for different project work. We also co-operate with complementary companies into forming high technology consortium related to the oil and gas activities and other energy projects

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positiom: Procurement Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Implement strategic plans for procurement operations &ndash; deliver value to the organization by focusing and aligning with company objectives such as right sourcing, right OEM/place, and right quality by adhering strictly to the end user description and specification, delivering on time and pay on time, comply with company procedure and policies by adopting the use of landing cost analysis table and freight calculator.
	Proactively ensure communication between the company, IOCs, stakeholders, and partners by building relationships to reduce turnaround time on request &ndash; make networking a priority.
	Ensure compliance with safety protocols, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Foster strong client relationships, understand their needs, and deliver tailored solutions.
	Collaborate with your team in securing contracts, company registration, networking, building relationships, and business development outreach &ndash; garner at least ten (10) purchase orders (PO/WO) every month - develop a dashboard or matrix to track and monitor your performance or progress weekly.
	Maintain good relationships with our clients and set up a weekly outreach program to foster opportunities
	Analyse performance, identify areas for improvement and implement process enhancements.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field (preferably with a second-class upper).
	Minimum 5+ years of experience in procurement and supply chain management.
	Proven track record in supply chain management, meeting deadlines, and exceeding client expectations.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, adapt to changing priorities, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Some Key Requirements include:
